enb_long_title: Workshop on synergies and cooperation with other conventions
sentences: Keynote Presentation: William Westermeyer, Global Climate Observing System (GCOS) Secretariat, emphasized the importance of high-quality, long-term observation data to address the needs of the Rio conventions, and outlined the GCOS strategies and global networks for observing atmospheric, oceanic and terrestrial systems.

Based on past experience, he recommended, inter alia: adhering to the GCOS Climate Monitoring Principles for in situ and satellite systems; improving data exchange and availability; and building capacity and improving observation systems by creating a donor fund and developing a global observation framework for defining regional impacts.
He stressed the need for global-level initiatives and for a regional approach to observation and implementation.
